line-7: About Network Rail… 🌟 Join Our Team at Network Rail! 🌟 Are you ready to make a difference in people's lives? At Network Rail, we connect passengers and freight customers, ensuring safe and efficient transportation across the country. We're an organisation where people truly matter, and when you join us, you matter to us and millions of others. Click here to watch our inspiring video to learn more about us! We're dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive organisation that reflects the passengers we serve. To achieve this, we're committed to becoming an open, diverse, and inclusive workplace, leveraging the skills and expertise of our talented workforce. Together, we strive to create a safe and accessible railway for everyone. Discover more about the importance of Diversity and Inclusion at Network Rail by clicking here. Investing in our people is key to enhancing the safety, reliability, and efficiency of our railway system. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact, then this opportunity is for you! About our people and the recruitment process - We're an inclusive employer of choice and we welcome applications from everyone! We encourage our colleagues to work flexibly, as we know traditional working patterns don't always fit. If you want to consider working flexibly, just let us know and we'll do our best to help and invest in your career with us, whilst you have a healthy work life balance. We're also a Disability Confident Leader employer and we'll try our best to adapt the process and offer a reasonable alternative to help support people with disabilities access, apply and interview for roles.
line-9: What I’m responsible for… The role will support the project managers within the team with various tasks to ensure the successful planning and execution of our projects. Our projects are based around team and individual leadership and behavioural development.
line-11: What does the average day look like? The team works with regional customers to assess their organisational leadership capability. We market our core leadership programmes, as well designing bespoke programmes to develop talent, and support succession planning. The Great Together projects build organisational capability, working with groups to understand their gaps, drive more effective teams, and shift organisational culture. With many exciting leadership and behavioural development projects being delivered to over 4000 delegates, a typical day could involve supporting the project managers by creating and maintaining project documents, such as schedules, budgets, and reports, managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and coordinating project timelines, conducting market research, and assisting with data analysis, and handling administrative duties like data entry, and organising project files. What essential skills and experiences are required? In this dynamic role, we're on the lookout for a candidate with a diverse skill set that includes valuable management experience, particularly in project management. We encourage individuals who have attained an HND/HNC or a similar educational standard to apply, recognizing the importance of a well-rounded academic background. Moreover, we value a strong understanding of Health, Safety, Quality, and Environmental (HSQE) awareness, encompassing relevant issues and principles. We believe in fostering an inclusive workplace where these skills contribute to our collaborative success, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us on this exciting journey. For a full list of the key accountabilities and criteria’s, please click apply. You will then be redirected to the Network Rails Careers page where you will be able to find the job description.
